payload.description:
Expose three scoped subagent lifecycle methods on PluginRuntime so external plugins (like openclaw-lcm) can spawn sub-agents without needing raw gateway dispatch access.

Add to PluginRuntime.subagent:
- run(params): Enqueue an agent run on a session key. Calls gateway 'agent' method internally. Returns { runId }.
- waitForRun(params): Block until a run completes. Calls gateway 'agent.wait' internally. Returns { status, error? }.
- deleteSession(params): Delete an ephemeral session. Calls gateway 'sessions.delete' internally. Returns void.

Implementation:
1. Add subagent types and property to src/plugins/runtime/types.ts
2. Wire implementation in wherever PluginRuntime is constructed (look at src/gateway/server-plugins.ts or similar). Use handleGatewayRequest with a synthetic operator client for internal dispatch â€” NOT callGateway which opens a WebSocket to itself.
3. Export types from plugin-sdk/index.ts so external plugins can reference them.
4. Add tests.

Branch: josh/context-engine (already checked out)
Do NOT touch any other branch.
payload.title: Add scoped subagent methods to PluginRuntime

payload.description: When the iMessage relay formats the system_note for incoming messages, it currently only includes the raw phone number (e.g. +12533704422). This causes the agent to not immediately know who sent the message, leading to unnecessary lookups and mistakes (checking wrong chat threads). Proposed fix: resolve phone number against Apple Contacts before formatting the relay header. Scripts already exist at ~/clawd/scripts/contacts_lookup.sh.
payload.title: iMessage relay: resolve contact name from phone number

payload.description:
Implement a **bounded Dolt context-engine plugin** with exactly three levels:
- L0: turns
- L1: leaves (summaries of turns only)
- L2: bindles (summaries of leaves only)

Core contract:
- No L3+ rollups; never summarize bindles into bindles.
- Runtime assembly order must always be `<bindles><leaves><turns>` oldest -> newest.
- Each bindle/leaf/turn must be injected as its own message unit (no single mega-turn bootstrap).
- Summary generation caps are hard limits in code.
- Persist hierarchical lineage in Dolt (bindle -> leaves -> turns) with per-record event timestamps.
- `/reset` and `/new` must finalize pending non-bindle material into a short bindle before session rotation.

Done means:
- Fits the ContextEngine plugin slot as engine id `dolt`.
- Can be enabled per-agent and/or default slot via config.
- Produces deterministic bounded behavior under token pressure.
- Ships with tests that fail if behavior regresses toward legacy compaction semantics.
payload.title: feat: bounded dolt context-engine plugin (turns/leaves/bindles)

payload.description:
Define strict Dolt rollup contracts and validate them in code.

Required metadata contract:
- Every persisted record (turn/leaf/bindle) includes an event timestamp (epoch ms).
- Leaf and bindle summary text must prepend YAML front-matter exactly:
  ---
  summary-type: leaf|bindle
  dates-covered: <startEpochMs>|<endEpochMs>
  children: [<direct-child-pointer>, ...]
  ---

Containment contract:
- Leaf children are turns only.
- Bindle children are leaves only.
- Children are stored in chronological order.
- `dates-covered` semantics:
  - Leaf: first-turn-ts | last-turn-ts
  - Bindle: first-leaf-generation-ts | last-leaf-generation-ts

Acceptance:
- Runtime validators reject invalid child levels.
- Front-matter parse/serialize helpers are deterministic.
- Tests cover malformed/invalid metadata and pointer-level violations.
payload.title: did: codify dolt lineage and yaml metadata contract

payload.description:
Implement bounded Dolt pressure policy with hysteresis and dynamic chunking.

Initial defaults (override-capable):
- L0 turns lane: soft=40k, delta=4k, target=36k.
- L1 leaves lane: soft=10k, delta=1k, target=9k, summaryCap=2000.
- L2 bindles lane: soft=10k, delta=1k, target=9k, summaryCap=2000.

Rules:
- Trigger when lane > soft+delta.
- Continue compacting while lane > target.
- Chunk sizing is pressure-driven and constrained by fresh-tail retention.
- Minimum chunk floor is 2 turns.
- Summary output caps are hard (max output tokens), not soft goals.

Acceptance:
- Deterministic evaluator decisions for trigger/drain/stop.
- Chunk selector honors pressure delta + fresh-tail + floor.
- Tests include outlier large-turn/tool-result cases.
payload.title: feat: implement dolt lane pressure hysteresis and chunk selector

payload.description:
Implement rollup execution path with strict two-step containment.

Required path:
- Only L0 -> L1 (turns -> leaves).
- Only L1 -> L2 (leaves -> bindles).
- Never L2 -> L3 and never bindle -> bindle aggregation.

Behavior:
- Rollups preserve chronological ordering and direct-child lineage.
- Leaf and bindle summaries are emitted with required YAML front-matter.
- Assembly for model context always buckets chronologically as `<bindles><leaves><turns>`.

Acceptance:
- Tests fail on any attempted cross-level or same-level invalid rollup.
- Assembly tests prove message ordering and per-message injection semantics.
payload.title: feat: enforce dolt rollup path and bounded assembly ordering

payload.description:
Implement reset/bootstrap lifecycle behavior for Dolt engine.

Reset behavior:
- On `/reset` or `/new`, finalize pending turns/leaves into a short bindle before rotating session context.
- This finalization is best-effort operationally but must be attempted through one shared reset utility path.

Bootstrap behavior:
- Hydrate active context from persisted Dolt lineage using bounded lanes.
- Prefer most recent bindles first, then most recent leaves, then most recent turns within lane budgets.
- Preserve chronological final assembly order `<bindles><leaves><turns>` oldest -> newest.

Acceptance:
- Both CLI and gateway reset surfaces execute the same finalization contract.
- Tests verify short-bindle creation on reset with pending non-bindle material.
- Bootstrap selection tests verify recency preference and ordering.
payload.title: feat: add dolt reset short-bindle finalization and bootstrap

payload.description:
Implement L2 bindle eviction policy for bounded Dolt behavior.

Rules:
- If L2 lane is over target, evict exactly one oldest active bindle at a time.
- Re-evaluate after each eviction; repeat recursively until lane <= target.
- Eviction removes only active-lane presence, not persisted lineage history.

Acceptance:
- Deterministic oldest-first order under tie conditions.
- Recursive one-at-a-time behavior validated by tests.
- Event telemetry includes before/after lane totals and eviction boundaries.
payload.title: feat: add deterministic oldest-first dolt bindle eviction

payload.description:
Wire Dolt engine into plugin registration and configuration selection.

Required outcomes:
- Register context-engine id `dolt`.
- Enable via `plugins.slots.contextEngine: dolt`.
- Allow per-agent opt-in override via agent context-engine selection.
- Preserve legacy engine behavior for agents not opted into Dolt.

Acceptance:
- Config schema/types/docs updated for slot + per-agent selection.
- Resolution precedence tests cover agent override, defaults, slot fallback.
- Example config shows enabling Dolt for one or more agents.
payload.title: did: wire dolt context-engine registration and per-agent enablement

payload.description:
Add end-to-end and focused tests that gate the bounded Dolt system.

Coverage required:
- Policy/hysteresis transitions and convergence to targets.
- Dynamic chunk sizing with fresh-tail and minimum chunk floor.
- Strict containment and lineage pointer levels.
- Front-matter shape/parseability + dates-covered correctness.
- Reset short-bindle finalization behavior.
- Bootstrap recency selection and ordering.
- L2 oldest-first one-at-a-time recursive eviction.
- Runtime integration proving selected `dolt` engine path is active (not legacy fallback).

Acceptance:
- Test suite fails if runtime returns to legacy compaction semantics when `dolt` is selected.
payload.title: test: gate bounded dolt runtime behavior end-to-end

payload.body:
Execution guardrails for all child work:
1) Runtime behavior must be implemented in the `dolt` ContextEngine path, not helper-only modules.
2) Selecting `contextEngine: dolt` must not silently route compaction through legacy behavior.
3) Keep level model bounded to exactly turns/leaves/bindles.
4) Use fixed summary output limits in generation calls for leaves/bindles.
5) Persist event timestamps and direct-child lineage for every rollup level.
6) Preserve chronological assembly order `<bindles><leaves><turns>` with one message per record.
7) `/new` and `/reset` must finalize pending non-bindle material into a short bindle before session rotation.
8) Retrieval augmentation is out of scope for this epic; baseline bounded compaction first.

Execution contract: implement hard validators + deterministic front-matter helpers first.
Required:
- child-level enforcement (leaf->turn only, bindle->leaf only)
- per-record event timestamp fields
- deterministic front-matter parse/serialize
Non-goals:
- no runtime pressure evaluator logic
- no config wiring in this task

Execution contract: implement evaluator + chunking as pure deterministic logic and connect to policy defaults/overrides.
Required:
- soft+delta trigger, target drain hysteresis
- fresh-tail-aware chunk sizing with floor=2
- fixed summary cap values exposed to caller
Non-goals:
- no rollup lineage persistence here
- no config slot registration work

Execution contract: implement bounded rollup operations and runtime assembly path.
Required:
- only turns->leaves and leaves->bindles
- no bindle->bindle path
- assembly order `<bindles><leaves><turns>`
- each assembled record remains a distinct message
Non-goals:
- no reset surface wiring in this task

Execution contract: wire reset/bootstrap lifecycle behavior through shared reset utility and dolt engine runtime.
Required:
- `/new` and `/reset` produce short bindle from pending turns/leaves before rotation
- bootstrap favors most recent bindles first, then leaves, then turns, within budgets
- final context ordering remains chronological by bucket
Non-goals:
- no retrieval cue injection beyond baseline bounded context

Execution contract: implement oldest-first one-at-a-time L2 eviction loop.
Required:
- evict single oldest active bindle per step
- re-evaluate until lane <= target
- persisted lineage remains intact
Non-goals:
- do not change rollup-level creation rules

Execution contract: plugin/config enablement only.
Required:
- register `dolt` engine id
- slot + per-agent selection precedence tests
- docs snippet for enabling one or more agents
Non-goals:
- avoid policy/rollup algorithm changes in this issue

Execution contract: this is the regression gate.
Required tests:
- fail if `dolt` selection routes through legacy compaction semantics
- fail on invalid child-level lineage
- fail on wrong bucket order or merged mega-message bootstrap
- fail if reset does not short-bindle finalize pending non-bindle material
